course.title: The Culture of Hysteria: From Nineteenth-Century France to Here and Now
course.description: As we read nineteenth-century medical, literary, and cultural texts with contemporary analogues, we ask why hysteria flourished in that time and place, and now this one, and trace the diagnosis as symptom of a broader cultural malaise.
course.notes: Conducted in English. Most readings in French.
